newsitem.title: USA: General Instrument modems free with service.
newsitem.headline: General Instrument modems free with service.

text.p: General Instrument Corp's SURFboard cable modem is available for free to some 2,000 Continental Cablevision Inc subscribers in Jacksonville, Fla., who want Internet access via cable, the companies said Monday.

Continental said it launched its high-speed Internet access service, Highway1, initially to 2,000 customers and expects a full commercial roll-out there in July. It plans to launch services in other areas as well.
There is no charge for the modem, but there is a monthly fee for the Internet service.
In July, Continental placed an order for 10,000 SURFboard modems and the associated equipment, General Instruments said.
